descrip: Paths for horse riding
Paths for cycling
Footpaths
Streets where pedestrians have priority
Motorway/freeway. 10x 12ft lanes, 4x 10ft shoulder
Roads that connect from one motorway/freeway to another
Unspecified paths
Pedestrian only streets
Primary roads, typically national (major arterial). 6x 12ft thru, 2x 6ft bike/park/shoulder
Roads that connect from one primary roads to another, typically national. Assume no shoulder/turn lanes
Roads in residential areas (minor/residential collector). 2x 14ft thru lane, 2x 6ft bike/park lane
Secondary roads, typically regional (minor arterial/major collector). 4x 12ft thru lane, 1x 10ft left turn lane, 2x 8ft bike/park/shoulder
Roads that connect from one secondary road to another, typically regional
Service roads for access to buildings, parking lots, etc. 1x 10ft lane, typically in parking lots
Flights of steps on footpaths
Tertiary roads, typically local (major/minor collector). 2x 12ft thru lane, 1x 10ft left turn lane, 2x 8ft bike/park/shoulder
Roads that connect from one tertiary road to another, typically local
For agricultural use, in forests, etc. Often gravel roads.
track with asphalt or heavily compacted
track with asphalt or moderately compacted
track lightly compacted
track uncompated, visible
track uncompated, hardly visible
Important roads, typically divided. 6x 12ft lane, 2x 6ft shoulder
Roads that connect from one important road to another, typically divided
Smaller local roads (local/collectors in non-residential areas, typically industrial). 2x 14ft thru lane, 2x 6ft bike/park lane
Unknown, ignore
